org.programus.nxj.util
Class DisplayUtil

java.lang.Object
  org.programus.nxj.util.DisplayUtil

public class DisplayUtil
extends Object

Display utility. A collection of advanced LCD screen display functions

Author:
Programus
See Also:
LCD, Graphics

Field Summary
static int NONE_FLAG
          Used by drawXxxCross functions, NONE_FLAG means no cross needed, in other words, just like normal draw function.
static int X_FLAG
          Used by drawXxxCross functions, X_FLAG means it will be drawn cross left or right boundary.
static int Y_FLAG
          Used by drawXxxCross functions, Y_FLAG means it will be drawn cross top or bottom boundary.

DisplayUtil()

Field Detail

NONE_FLAG

public static final int NONE_FLAG
Used by drawXxxCross functions, NONE_FLAG means no cross needed, in other words, just like normal draw function.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

X_FLAG

public static final int X_FLAG
Used by drawXxxCross functions, X_FLAG means it will be drawn cross left or right boundary.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Y_FLAG

public static final int Y_FLAG
Used by drawXxxCross functions, Y_FLAG means it will be drawn cross top or bottom boundary.

See Also:

Method Detail

drawStringCenter

public static void drawStringCenter(String string,
                                    int row)
Draw a string on the LCD screen center alignment.

Parameters:
string - the string to be drawn
row - the row number to draw the string. The row num should be 0-7.

drawStringCenter

public static void drawStringCenter(String string,
                                    int y,
                                    boolean invert)
Draw a string on the LCD screen center alignment.

Parameters:
string - the string to be drawn
y - the vertical position to draw the string
invert - true if you want to draw the string invert in color.
See Also:
LCD.drawString(String, int, int, boolean)

drawStringRight

public static void drawStringRight(String string,
                                   int y,
                                   int right,
                                   boolean invert)
Draw a string on the LCD screen right alignment.

Parameters:
string - the string to be drawn
y - the vertical position to draw the string
right - right margin
invert - true if you want to draw the string invert in color.

drawRectCross

public static void drawRectCross(int x,
                                 int y,
                                 int w,
                                 int h,
                                 int flag)
Draw a rectangle cross the LCD screen.

Example:

 Rect: 
  +-------+ 
  +-------+
 When you draw this Rect by applying X_FLAG:
 +-----------------------------+
 |                             |
 |                      (x,y)  |
 |----+                    +---|
 |----+                    +---|
 |                             | <- Screen boundary
 |                             |
 |                             |
 +-----------------------------+

Parameters:
x -
y -
w -
h -
flag -
